featured.text: The economic crisis may have also played a role: Homeowners who were not able to pay their bank loans were forced to abandon their properties, sometimes leaving behind swimming pools that made excellent mosquito breeding grounds.
With the worsening of global economic conditions, it seems wiser and more _____ to keep cash in the bank rather than to invest in the stock market.
Publicly financed projects are often ______ or delayed during tough economic times due to a lack of resources.
Despite the economic and environmental hurdles, desalination is becoming increasingly attractive as human beings are using up fresh water from other sources.

other.text: However, their demand is high because many people buy them to tell the world that they have money, 28 as conspicuous consumption in economics.
Called the diamond-water paradox, this is a classic problem posed to students of economics.

definition.en_def: Relating to the economy or the management of resources.
definition.example: The government implemented new policies to improve the economic situation.
